dataList.content: Another veteran appeared from the dark, his gait grim and heavy.
He must've been a high-ranking soldier once—despite its age, his badge still gleamed.
I think I know your face. But from where?

dataList.title: G Corp. Remnant
dataList.content: ... I was the head manager of your team.

dataList.title: G Corp. Remnant
dataList.content: It's incredible how a deserter like you has the audacity to kill my men—they were once your own comrades, you know.
Look, the war ended a decade ago. Haven't any of you learned to move on from playing soldiers?

dataList.title: G Corp. Remnant
dataList.content: The war might've ended for you when you deserted G Corp....

dataList.title: G Corp. Remnant
dataList.content: ... but for the rest of us—we never left the battlefield, even to this day.
As much as I'd rather not relate to you this way...
I’m not really that different here.

dataList.title: G Corp. Remnant
dataList.content: Then you ought to understand, Manager Gregor.
You say that like it means something... But it’s against company policy to carry out summary execution for personal revenge, bossman.
